availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania:
City and County of Philadelphia: ss.

I, Kinley J. Tener, residing in the city and county of Philadelphia, in the state of Pennsylvania, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, Commissioner of Deeds, under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of said State of Kentucky, entitled "An act to adopt the Revised Statutes," approved January 7th 1852, for the State of Kentucky within the State of Pennsylvania, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner, and by virtue of the laws of the said state of Kentucky, and that the following is an impression of my seal of office.

figure.ab:
KINLEY J. TENNER
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
PHILADELPHIA, PENNA

body.p: Taken and subscribed before me, this Nineteeth day of October, 1865. Witness my hand and official seal.

Hugh W. Tenner
Commissioner of Kentucky for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

figure.ab:
HUGH W. TENNER
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
PHILADELPHIA PENNA

body.p:
Comr Deeds
Pennsylvania
Oath of K J. Tener
filed 25 Oct 1865
Comr of Deeds
Kinley J. Tener
comd 14 Oct 1865
Recommended by P. Swigert & fee paid by him
